Well, I have to say, it's a hidden gem in Paris! This beautiful fountain is located in the Square Saint-M√©dard and it's definitely worth a visit.  The Fontaine de la Vierge features a stunning statue of the Virgin Mary, surrounded by intricate details and ornate carvings. It's a peaceful and serene spot, perfect for taking a break from the hustle and bustle of the city.  The fountain itself is quite charming, with water flowing gently from the statue. It adds a touch of tranquility to the surrounding area. Whether you're looking to relax, take some photos, or simply enjoy the atmosphere, the Fontaine de la Vierge is a lovely spot to visit.  Just a heads up, it's not as well-known as some of the other famous landmarks in Paris, so you might find it to be a quieter and more peaceful experience. And of course, don't forget to snap some pictures to capture the beauty of this hidden gem!  So, if you're in Paris and looking for a serene and beautiful spot, definitely check out the Fontaine de la Vierge in the Square Saint-M√©dard. Enjoy your visit! üòÑüì∏

Ah, the Fontaine de la Vierge in Paris! It's a lovely fountain located in the 7th arrondissement, near the Rue Saint-Dominique. This beautiful fountain features a statue of the Virgin Mary holding the baby Jesus, hence its name.  The Fontaine de la Vierge is a great spot to take a moment and appreciate the beauty of Paris. It's not as well-known as some other fountains in the city, which means it's often less crowded, allowing you to have a peaceful experience. The intricate details of the statue and the surrounding architecture make it a sight worth seeing.  If you're in the area, I highly recommend taking a stroll around and exploring the charming streets nearby. You'll find various shops, cafes, and boutiques to enjoy. And if you're a fan of art, the Mus√©e d'Orsay is also within walking distance, where you can admire an impressive collection of masterpieces.  Is there anything specific you would like to know about the Fontaine de la Vierge or anything else I can assist you with?

It is one of the most favorite sightseeings in Paris. Interesting place with stories behind every single sculpture. Located in the 7th district, it is near the Eiffel Tower and Champ de Mars and features a statue of the Virgin Mary holding a scepter, and water runs from the scepter into a tank below. It is not only a stunning piece of art but also a charming landmark in Paris for locals and visitors.

Time of visit: second half of March 2014. During our visit to Jean XXIII Square, behind Notre Dame Cathedral, we enjoyed the Virgin's fountain from the middle of the 19th century, which is located here. The fountain is a very slender triangular building, ten meters high. Besides us, there were many visitors who enjoyed the park and the fountain.

At the back of Notre Dame, in a small but very pretty garden, there is this triangle-shaped fountain with an impressive 10m high and 4 sculptures, one of them of the Virgin with the baby Jesus in the center in the shape of a tower
The fountain was created by Alphonse Vigoureux in 1845, to equip the square Jean-XXIII, created the previous year.

Small fountain located in the gardens behind the Notre Dame Cathedral. The Fontaine de la Vierge dates back to 1845 and is made up of three columns in the center of which is the statue of the Virgin and Child.

It was destroyed by a fire, and for a while it remained that beautiful place. The cathedral can no longer be seen. Someday, I'll see Notre Dame Cathedral again. It is the ideal place to enjoy and understand the wonder of Gothic architecture, with its buttresses and flying buttresses, which revolutionized the world, achieving light walls with large windows that illuminated the naves of the churches in an incredible and novel way.

In the center of the neo-Gothic columns houses a Virgin and Child, sculpted by Louis-Parfait Merlieux [1796-1855] which dates from the year 1845 located in the Jean XXIII square behind the apse of Notre-Dame cathedral from Paris.
